data.title: Scene Loads Improperly In-game
data.body:
Here's the forum post: 
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=786&p=3665#p3665

Basically playing the scene from the editor runs perfectly fine, but if I run my menu screen scene first then from the menu screen I load up the same scene the framerate is unbearable and at least one script just doesn't function anymore. Thanks!

data.title: add Tweeners
data.body:
[Tweener](http://losersjuegos.com.ar/referencia/articulos/interpolaciones)s are cool because it adds realistic movement to your sprites or InstanceMesh nodes, or change other numerical property through time.

And I noticed that Godot have no tweener objects/functions, so, this may be a good feature for the engine!

data.title: Light Shader work but don't in game and not save!
data.body:
I compile version of code from this last build and try make a shader.
It work's on editing
![captura de tela de 2014-07-22 21 53 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/85936/3671235/8a588bc4-124d-11e4-9442-49d0032e061b.png)

But not in game. And worst is it not save! When I reopen engine the code is missing.

data.title: Bugs when assigning textures to default-named sprites
data.body:
System: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Occurence: Pong tutorial
Process:
1. Add node "Node2d"
2.  Add Node2d's child node "Sprite".  Leave name unaltered
3.  Set Sprite's texture: left_pallet.png
-- error 1: displays as nearly-flat horizontal line in editor.  Does not render as such in the test run.
4.  Add Node2d's child node Sprite "Sprite 2"
5.  Set Sprite 2's texture: right_pallet.png
-- error 2: any prior size edits to "Sprite" will be inherited in the editor.  Does not render as such in the test run.
-- error 3: size edits to the above for proper viewing will warp their representations in the test view.

bug-free process:
1.  Create Node2 node.
2.  Add all child sprite nodes.
3.  Rename sprite nodes accordingly.
4.  Set textures for each respective node.

data.title: 2D Physics performance issue
data.body:
How to reproduce:
1. In 2D Platformer project, open bullet.xml
2. Select "Timer" node, change Wait Time to longer period, e.g. 300
3. Publish game to mobile device, shooting bullets

In iPad2:
    0 bullets  - 60fps
    10 bullets - 54
    20 bullets - 30 fps
    30 bullets - 20
    40 bullets - 20 
    50 bullets - 15

Found one blog post doing physics benchmark on iPad1 in 2011 (http://tech.flyclops.com/battle-of-the-ios-physics-engines-197), here's the their result of box2d on iPad 1:

```
200 rigidbody 60fps
370 rigidbody 30fps
406 rigidbody 15fps
```

data.title: Fixed #470 View grid toggle in 3d not working
data.body: Fixed issue #470 View grid toggle in 3d not working

data.title: Fixed failed to connect to remote debugger with -rdebug will crash engine
data.body: ScriptDebuggerRemote instance is created and assigned to ScriptDebugger::singleton and will deleted when connection failed; Make sure it's set to NULL in destructor.

data.title: Add option to NOT pause iOS game execution when resigning active
data.body:
- If there's "ios/ios/pause_when_resign_active" project setting as false, then game execution will not be paused until it's actually entered background
- Player can still see game been updated when they're doing fast app switching

data.title: Fixed ios release event not been dispatched when app entering background
data.body: - only first touch been registered in mouse_list, when app entering backgroud and touchesCancelled been invoked, only first touch release event been dispatched

data.title: Display tile name in "tile choose/pick" menu
data.body: I'd like to be able to display the name of each tile, which I suppose would be the sprite name in the tile editor scene, next to each tile in the left pane when editing tilemaps.  Similar tiles can be difficult to distinguish in this view, especially when they are scaled down.

data.title: Script Editor is empty
data.body:
Hi Reduz,

I am at a Ubuntu 64 machine and wanted to edit a script from a demo, but as soon as I click on the script button and the view changes to the script view, ubuntus crash handler pops up and tells me that he received a sigarbt.. The editor is still visible but there is no content in it.
After that I tried to create a new project but as soon as I want to create a script the same thing happens.

Tried it with a completely fresh compile just a moment ago and with the official release - both are non working here.

I tried godot a few weeks after it was open sourced - back then there was no problem to change the view to the script view...

Greetings, Thomas

data.title: ERROR: VisualServerRaster::_draw_viewport when 2d/3d editor viewport been covered
data.body:
error message:

```
ERROR: VisualServerRaster::_draw_viewport:  Condition ' desired_rect.width<=0 ||
 desired_rect.height<=0 ' is true.
At:  servers\visual\visual_server_raster.cpp:5763
```

how to reproduce:

```
1. run scene from editor
2. cover 2d or 3d viewport by pulling up "output" pannel
3. repeating error message printing in console
```

data.title: Globals::localize_path was calling change_dir to check if path exists
data.body: - Globals::localize_path was calling change_dir to check if path exists which has side-effect of changing current directory;Fix by calling new dir_exists api

data.title: Make TouchScreenButton handle events
data.body: When a touch is processed by a TouchScreenButton, the touch is still processed by a node that's set to process unhandled input.  The TouchScreenButton should prevent the event from being seen as unhandled.

data.title: Exported parameters are not properly read when the instance of a resource has its own script
data.body:
Let say an object (scene) contains a script. And then I create a different script extending the script of the object to apply it to an instance of the object. If I export a parameter in the second script, it will always have the default value at runtime, no matter what I set in the instance's property. There's a diagram explaining it:
![67i6f6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/587885/3544897/ab467b06-0871-11e4-8f9b-e0656f204ced.jpg)
In class N2, param2 has a default value, that instance cannot modify. However param1 can be modified.

I created an example for this case. You can download it here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1UVb9K9E3_8UHhwVllQWV9DLWc/edit?usp=sharing

data.title: Import 3D Scene's Collision Flag Doesn't Work
data.body: Hey, there. When importing a 3D scene, and you add a "-col" to the end of an object in that scene's name, Godot doesn't create a static mesh for the object. I've also noticed a "}" in the text after -col in the 3D scene Importing window. Using the latest Godot (July 6th), and Windows 7 64-bit.

data.title: Typing in editor crashes Godot (while typing property export statement)
data.body:
I have the following written in the script editor:

export var weapon =

I go in to type this:

export(int, "basic", "super") var weapon = 0

When I try to type the closing quote at the end of "basic", Godot becomes unresponsive and starts spitting out this message in a loop:

At: modules/gdscript/gd_tokenizer.cpp:932.
ERROR: get_token_constant: Condition ' tk_rb[ofs].type!=TK_CONSTANT ' is true. returned: tk_rb[0].constant
